newsitem.title: USA: Advanced Micro to cut chip prices. [CORRECTED 23:40 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Advanced Micro to cut chip prices. [CORRECTED 23:40 GMT]

text.p: Advanced Micro Devices Monday cut prices on it K6 computer chips by as much as 55 percent.

In a statement, the company said the AMD-K6/233 processor is now priced at $289 (corrects from $290), down from $469, the AMD-K6/200 is now $189, down from $349, and the AMD-K6/166 is now $109, down from $244.
The move comes the same day microprocessor giant Intel Corp also cut prices on its chips as much as 57 percent.

"This price reduction maintains AMD's strategy of selling the AMD-K6 processor for at least 25 percent less than Intel products at comparable performance levels," said Vinod Dham, group vice president of AMD's Computation Products Group.

"Our value proposition remains unchanged: no matter how much or how little users want to spend for their PCs, they will get higher performance from systems based on the AMD-K6 processor." AMD said it shipped approximately 10,000 AMD-K6 units in the first quarter of this year and more than 350,000 AMD-K6 processors during the second quarter. AMD plans to produce more than one million units this quarter.
